channel.title: News on Cryptocurrency Cabal
channel.description: Recent content in News on Cryptocurrency Cabal

item.title: Bitcoin Technology Piques Interest on Wall St.
item.description:
New York Times, Bitcoin Technology Piques Interest on Wall St., 28 August 2015 (by Nathaniel Popper).

… the innovations that helped turn Bitcoin into the most popular virtual currency are now being viewed as a potentially enormous disruptive force for several industries, including accounting, music and journalism. Nowhere, though, are more money and resources being spent on the technology than on Wall Street â€” the very industry that Bitcoin was created to circumvent.

item.title: Ombuds: Using Bitcoin to make online messages 'immutable'
item.description:
There’s an article about the Ombuds project created by Alex Kuck and Nick Skelsey to use the bitcoin blockchain for communications:

Ombuds: Using Bitcoin to make online messages ‘immutable’, Journalism.co.uk, 20 August 2015.

Alex and Nick graduated from UVa in Spring 2015, and helped develop the first offering of this course, including creating the PointCoin cryptocurrency.
